definition: see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure

sentences.english: This salesman demonstrated how to cook with a pressure cooker.
sentences.chinese: 這個傾銷員當衆演示如何用壓力鍋煮東西。

sentences.english: Well, I just don't happen to have an oven-like pressure vessel I can heat.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，我只是碰巧沒有用來加熱的壓力鍋。

sentences.english: In essence, autoclaves are industrial-sized rotating pressure-cookers.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，蒸壓熱處理用的就是工業級別的旋轉壓力鍋。

sentences.english: Later for a long time I have been haunted by the episode of this pressure cooker.
sentences.chinese: 此後很長一段時間，我被這隻壓力鍋的故事所纏繞。

sentences.english: The salesman demonstrated how to cook with a pressure cooker .
sentences.chinese: 這個推銷員當衆表演如何用壓力鍋煮東西。

sentences.english: That is the pressure cooker we talked about before.
sentences.chinese: 也就是我們之前提到的壓力鍋。

sentences.english: With the help of the pressure-cooker, we cook chicken soup with less time and gas.
sentences.chinese: 我們用壓力鍋燉雞湯，節省了時間和煤氣。

sentences.english: When the pressure-cooker is decompressed abnormally, the utility model can be used repeatedly without changing component.
sentences.chinese: 當壓力鍋非正常泄壓後，無需更換部件便可重複使用。

sentences.english: A pressure cooker being sold at such a high price made me amazed.
sentences.chinese: 一隻壓力鍋竟可售賣到如此高價，讓我不由驚歎。

sentences.english: The utility model relates to an explosion-proof safety window for a pressure cooker.
sentences.chinese: 本實用新型涉及一種壓力鍋安全防爆窗。

sentences.english: A pressure cooker shall be applied for the food hard to boil, it is time-saving and energy-efficient.
sentences.chinese: 不易煮爛的食物應選用壓力鍋，既省時又節能。

sentences.english: Put the silverside in a pressure cooker.
Allianz Arena will be a pressure cooker.
sentences.chinese: 安聯球場就象一個壓力鍋。

sentences.english: Boiling Water Reactors are similar to a pressure cooker.
sentences.chinese: 沸水反應堆和我們平時用的蒸汽壓力鍋類似。

sentences.english: The utility model provides a pressure-regulating pressure-limited valve for a pressure cooker.
sentences.chinese: 本實用新型提供了一種壓力鍋用調壓式限壓閥。

definition: to buy on a considerable scale/to purchase/to procure/to stock up
to plan a military mission on a sand table (idiom)/to rehearse a planned action or activity/to conduct a dry run
fish maw/a food dish made from the swim bladder of fish
